title: 107_hr874
content:
The Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001, also known as the Reduction in Marginal Income Tax Rates for Individuals, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by eliminating hidden rates and reducing marginal income tax rates for individuals. The Reduction in Marginal Income Tax Rates for Individuals, under the Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001, aims to amend the tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses for the year 2002. The tax rates for taxable income under the Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001 are as follows:
- Not over $12,000: 14% of taxable income
- Over $12,000 but not over $45,200: $1,680 plus 15% of the excess over $12,000
- Over $45,200 but not over $109,250: $6,660 plus 27% of the excess over $45,200
- Over $109,250 but not over $166,450: $23,953.50 plus 30% of the excess over $109,250 The tax rates for heads of households under the Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001 are as follows:
- Over $166,450 but not over $297,300: $41,113.50 plus 35% of the excess over $166,450
- Over $297,300: $86,911 plus 38% of the excess over $297,300 If taxable income is not over $10,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For income over $10,000 but not over $36,250, the tax is $1,400 plus 15% of the excess over $10,000. For income over $36,250 but not over $93,600, the tax is $5,337.50 plus 27% of the excess over $36,250. For income over $93,600 but not over $151,600, the tax is $20,822 plus 30% of the excess over $93,600. For income over $151,600 but not over $297,300, the tax rates are different. The tax rates for unmarried individuals are as follows: $20,822 plus 30% of the excess over $93,600 for income over $93,600 but not over $151,600, $38,222 plus 35% of the excess over $151,600 for income over $151,600 but not over $297,300, and $89,217 plus 38% of the excess over $297,300 for income over $297,300. A tax is imposed on the taxable income of unmarried individuals, with rates varying based on income brackets. Tax rates for unmarried individuals vary based on income brackets:
- Not over $6,000: 14% of taxable income
- Over $6,000 but not over $27,050: $840 plus 15% of excess over $6,000
- Over $27,050 but not over $65,550: $3,997.50 plus 27% of excess over $27,050
- Over $65,550 but not over $136,750: $14,362.50 plus 30% of excess over $65,550
- Over $136,750 but not over $297,300: (tax rate not provided) For married individuals filing separate returns, the tax rates are as follows:
- Over $136,750 but not over $297,300: $35,752.50 plus 35% of excess
- Over $297,300: $91,945 plus 38% of excess Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to a tax based on a specific table if they do not file jointly with their spouse. For taxable income not over $6,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For income over $6,000 but not over $22,600, the tax is $840 plus 15% of the excess over $6,000. For income over $22,600 but not over $54,625, the tax is $3,330 plus 27% of the excess over $22,600. For income over $54,625 but not over $83,225, the tax is $11,976.75 plus 30% of the excess over $54,625. For income over $83,225 but not over $148,650, a specific tax rate applies. The tax rates for income over $83,225 but not over $148,650 are $20,556.75 plus 35% of the excess. For income over $148,650, the tax rate is $43,455.50 plus 38% of the excess. Phasein of 2006 Rates of 10, 15, 25, and 33 Percent is also mentioned. The tax rates for income over $83,225 but not over $148,650 are $20,556.75 plus 35% of the excess. For income over $148,650, the tax rate is $43,455.50 plus 38% of the excess. Phasein of 2006 Rates of 10, 15, 25, and 33 Percent is also mentioned, with reductions in tax rates beginning in 2002. The tax rates are set to decrease gradually over the years, with reductions of 1 percentage point in various taxable years for different income brackets. The tax rates are scheduled to decrease gradually over the years, with reductions of 1 percentage point in each taxable year after 2002 and before 2006, and an additional 2 percentage points in taxable years starting in 2006. The Secretary will adjust the tables to implement these reductions. Additionally, there will be an inflation adjustment for rates in 2002, with changes made to the prescribed tables under subsection (f) of section 1. The tax rates will be adjusted by changing the years from 1993 to 2001 and from 1992 to 2000. A new paragraph will be added for special rules regarding certain brackets for calendar years 2002 through 2006. The Secretary will not adjust the dollar amounts for the first and second rate brackets during this period. The tax rates for certain brackets will be adjusted for calendar years after 2006 by using a cost-of-living adjustment based on the year 2005 instead of 2000. The dollar amounts in subparagraph (A) will be adjusted by substituting '2005' for '2000'. Various provisions are amended by replacing "1992" with "2000" in multiple sections. The dollar amounts in multiple sections will be adjusted by substituting '2005' for '2000'. Sections such as 63(c)(4)(B), 68(b)(2)(B), 132(f)(6)(A)(ii), 135(b)(2)(B)(ii), 146(d)(2)(B), 151(d)(4), 220(g)(2), 221(g)(1)(B), 512(d)(2)(B), 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), 685(c)(3)(B), 877(a)(2), 911(b)(2)(D)(ii)(II), 2032A(a)(3)(B), 2503(b)(2)(B), and 2631(c)(2) are affected. Sections 25A(h)(1)(A)(ii) and 25A(h)(2)(A)(ii) are amended by striking certain text. Sections 25A(h)(1)(A)(ii) and 25A(h)(2)(A)(ii) are amended by striking certain text. Additionally, there are amendments to section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) and section 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) regarding percentage changes, as well as changes to section 1(h) involving the reduction of the percentage from 28% to 15% in certain paragraphs. The text chunk involves various sections being amended to change percentage rates, such as reducing from 39.6% to 33%, and from 15% to 10%. Section 3402(p)(2) amended to reduce percentage from 15% to 10%, Section 3402(q)(1) amended to reduce percentage from 28% to 15%, Section 3402(r)(3) amended to reduce percentage from 31% to 25%, and Section 3406(a)(1) amended to reduce percentage from 31% to 25%. Secretary of the Treasury may adjust percentages for coordination. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001, with specific withholding provisions applying to amounts paid after the same date. Repeal of phaseouts of deduction for personal exemptions and itemized deductions will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001. Repeal of Phaseout of Personal Exemptions: Subsection (d) of section 151 is amended by striking paragraph (3) and making technical amendments to section 1(f) and section 151(d). Paragraph (4) of section 151(d) is amended to increase the dollar amount in paragraph (1) for taxable years after 1989 based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. Repeal of Overall Limitation on Itemized Deductions under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by substituting 'calendar year 1988' for 'calendar year 2000' in subparagraph (B) thereof. Repeal of Section 68 and technical amendments to related sections. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of the tax code, including striking certain subparagraphs and clauses. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001.
